result.execSummary:
The defendant Carlos Castillo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Carlos Castillo is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Carlos Castillo was found guilty of Injury by Intoxicated Use/Vehicle, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.25(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees. 
** Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
** Pay DNA surcharge (unless previously paid).
** Pay restitution plus surcharges.  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered. DOC shall promptly notify the court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.  Not to unlawfully operate a motor vehicle.

timeConds.notes: Deft may serve his time in Milwaukee.  It is the Court's expectation that all non-working hours are to be spent in the KCJ subject to the authority granted to the Sheriff under the Statutes.  Huber allowed for work & childcare - not to exceed 60hr/wk

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carlos Castillo

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Denise Hertz-McGrath.  Victim rights compliance.  Victim present; victim statement made.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for 4yrs.  See conditions.  Deft sentenced to (1)yr in the KCJ as a condition of probation.  It is the Court's expectation that all non-working hours are to be spent in the KCJ subject to the authority granted to the Sheriff under the Statutes.  Deft may serve his time in Milw.  Bond to be applied towards restitution first then court obligations.  Deft stipulates to restitution in the amount of $6,953.42.
from Atty Hertz-McGrath w/ attached letters of recommendation
WCS Supervision Status Report.  Defendant has satisfied the program requirements per Statute 85.53.
Completion of traffic school report, WCS report, and statement of account

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Denise Hertz-McGrath.  Deft pleads guilty to count 1; found guilty by the Court.  Remaining counts are dismissed on State's motion.  Parties waive PSI.  Sentencing set for 6/8/15 @ 3pm.

Minutes:  NO RECORD TAKEN.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Hertz-McGrath.  State to provide medical records to the defense tomorrow.  Plea hrg set for 5/20/15 @ 3:30pm.  Atty Hertz-McGrath is hopeful to review the records and meet with her client prior to 5/20/15.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Denise Hertz-McGrath.  Parties not ready to proceed with the plea hrg today; still waiting for medical records.  State ordered to produce a subpoena for the court to sign @ 11am.  Parties instructed to return today @ 3pm.
WCS - compliant

email received from ADA Krejcarek requesting an adjournment; no objection by defense counsel.  Per Court - adjourn for three weeks with plea cutoff 5 days before.

Per court, leave on for JS for 4/27/15 @ 9am.  Parties to notify the court by 4/21/15 if the case is resolved.  ADA Krejcarek reports she will follow up with the detective and/or the physician.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Burgoyne & ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Hertz-McGrath.   ADA Burgoyne reported the medical records were received on 1/26/15 but sent to prior counsel in error.  State will make another copy of the medical reports and turn them over today to Atty Hertz-McGrath.  Defense counsel reports she needs time to obtain add'l discovery; she just received the 911 tape and some discovery three weeks ago.  Leave on trial for 2/23/15 @ 9am.  State to file a written response/report by the close of business tomorrow to deft's discovery demand.  If Atty Hertz-McGrath still feels a motion to compel is needed, she may contact the clerk to obtain a hrg date.

2:44 pm    Attorney Patrick Anderson appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Hilary Edwards.  Clerk:  LE.    Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; set before Comm Mason on 6-17-14 @ 10:30.  $2500 cash bond set with conditions.

*Not to possess or consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License.  If released, Report to WCS by 11:00 the next business day; Submit to random UA's upon request.  Comply w/ all program requirements & provide all required information.  *No contact with Anthony S or his residence
